one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. What from the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study impacted you most in the past week?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read 1 Peter 3:1-7.
Peter described biblical relationships in marriage.

questions.questionText: 3. Describe biblical submission in this passage. How does this compare to your understanding of submission?
4. Describe how a husband is to treat his wife.
5. What do you learn about the impact of marital honor and submission on your relationship with God? How does this influence your view of your own marriage or marriage in general?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read 1 Peter 3:8-22.
Peter described the biblical response to unjust suffering.

questions.questionText: 6. What practical principles does Peter give for living peaceably in a hostile culture? Which is hardest for you?
7. How are Christians to respond to insults, evil or suffering for doing right?
8. Describe the hope and encouragement you receive from recalling the suffering of Jesus. (See Isaiah 53; Matthew 4:1-11; 26:36-28:20.)

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read 1 Peter 4.
Peter described a biblical perspective on sin and suffering.

questions.questionText: 9. How does Christ's attitude shape our view of sin and suffering?
10. Why might Christians be surprised by their suffering?
11. What do you learn about suffering from this passage? How is God working in any suffering you are experiencing now?
12. What do you learn about God or yourself?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read 1 Peter 5.
Peter concluded with a charge to church leaders and members.

questions.questionText: 13. What instructions did Peter give to the elders? What instructions did he give to the younger ones?
14. Why is humility in a church context so important?
15. How could being a part of a family of believers make a difference in times of trouble?
16. Through this week's lesson, how is God moving you to engage with the world, share a truth about His Word or sacrificially show His love and kindness?
17. Passage Discovery (homiletics, word study, etc.) for group and administrative leaders: 1 Peter 3-5
